central_thesis: The Temple of Set is an initiatory school and a unique path of self-realization and ennoblement, founded on the metaphysical authenticity and license derived from the 'Book of Coming Forth by Night'. It aims to guide individuals (the 'Elect') to transform their consciousness to a higher state of being, distinct from the objective universe, through deliberate application of Black Magic and philosophical exploration, ultimately achieving personal divinity (Xeper). The Temple functions as a 'living book' that evolves its philosophy and organizational structure through the contributions of its Initiates, while avoiding the pitfalls of previous occult traditions.

structure_content.summary: Describes the founding of the Temple of Set as an evolution from the Church of Satan, emphasizing its unique metaphysical authenticity and purpose for individual self-realization, distinct from past occult movements.

Details the inherent tensions and dilemmas within the Church of Satan leading to its 1975 dissolution, and Michael Aquino's Greater Black Magical (GBM) working as the catalyst for the Temple of Set's inception.

Explores the phenomenon of the 'Book of Coming Forth by Night' as the foundational text and philosophical cornerstone of the Temple of Set, defining it as a 'revelation anomaly' and an experience of self-transformation, not a dictated text.

Addresses the Temple's adoption of ancient Egyptian philosophy and iconography, rejecting Judaeo/Christian frameworks and reinterpreting the 'neteru' as Forms or First Principles of existence, with Set as the ultimate Universal inspiration.

Outlines the initial organizational design of the Temple of Set, including its non-profit corporate structure, the Council of Nine, and the evolving initiatory degree system (I°-V°), drawing on past organizational experience.

Discusses the Temple's distinct Left-Hand Path philosophy, emphasizing individual self-deification (Xeper) as opposed to merging with a universal whole, and contextualizing it against traditional Satanism and RHP.

Explores the concept of initiation as self-transformation from ordinary to 'higher' consciousness, referencing Plato's 'Pyramid of Thought' and Ouspensky's states of consciousness, and defines the Magus and Ipsissimus degrees.

Examines the diverse interpretations and early challenges within the Temple, including the 'Wewelsburg Working' and its role in reconstituting the Order of the Trapezoid, highlighting the personal nature of Setian initiation.

Details the Temple's post-Barrett High Priesthood period, focusing on integrating accumulated knowledge, refining administrative structures, and developing the 'Jeweled Tablets of Set' as core reference documents.

Describes Michael Aquino's personal magical working at Wewelsburg Castle, which led to the re-establishment of the Order of the Trapezoid, emphasizing its Germanic esoteric roots and unique magical significance.

structure_content.chapter_title: 10 - The Orders, the Pylons, and the Elements
structure_content.summary: Provides an overview of the distinct sub-organizational structures within the Temple: Orders (specialized philosophical focus), Pylons (local or interest-based groups), and Elements (project-oriented groups).
Refines the definitions and functions of the Temple's six initiatory degrees (Setian I° to Ipsissimus VI°), emphasizing individual recognition of a 'state of being' rather than external conferral.
Focuses on the international growth and development of the Temple of Set.
Addresses the impact of 1980s 'Satanic crime' myths and witch-hunts on the Temple of Set's public image and the viability of Left-Hand Path religions.
Discusses the Temple's integration of computers, cyberspace, and the internet for communication and operations, exploring the augmentative and potentially harmful effects on its initiatory function.
Documents Michael Aquino's resignation from the High Priesthood to Magus Don Webb, reflecting on his personal journey, discoveries, and relationship with Lilith.
Provides an overview of the Temple of Set during Magus Don Webb's High Priesthood (1996-2002), analyzing changes, successes, failures, and his Ipsissimus VI° Recognition.
Examines Magistra Zeena Schreck's High Priestess period (2002-) and her eventual departure, including her background, relationship with Nikolas Schreck, and influences within the Temple.
Introduces Magistra Patty Hardy's High Priestess period (2004-) and her focus on archaeoastronomy and ancient Egyptian metaphysics, presented as an ongoing, 'unfinished' exploration.
A concluding reflection on the Temple of Set's 30-year journey, its impact on Initiates and society, its successes and failures, and its future prospects for survival and evolution.

key_concepts.definition: The Egyptian hieroglyphic term for 'to become/to be/to come into being'; the experience of an individual psyche becoming aware of its own existence and deciding to expand and evolve that existence through its own actions; the process of self-transformation and evolution of the Will.

Ancient Egyptian term translated as 'god-like', 'holy', 'divine', 'sacred', 'power', 'strength', 'force', 'strong', 'fortify', 'mighty', 'protect'. Reinterpreted as fundamental conscious, natural principles or 'Forms' of existence, not anthropomorphic gods in the conventional sense.

Greater Black Magic (GBM) is the causing of change to occur in the subjective universe in accordance with the will, potentially causing similar changes in the objective universe. Lesser Black Magic (LBM) is the influencing of beings, processes, or objects in the objective universe by applying obscure physical or behavioral laws.

Involves the conscious attempt to preserve and strengthen one’s isolate, psychecentric existence against the objective universe, while apprehending, comprehending, and influencing a varying number of subjective universes (SU). Distinguished from RHP by not seeking to dissolve the self into a universal whole.

The immortal, isolate, unique essence of every conscious being, human and nonhuman. It is the authentic self, distinct from the physical body and objective universe, and capable of self-creation and evolution.

A unique level of philosophical perspective or 'magical & philosophical climate', characterized by a dominant 'Word' or principle (e.g., Æon of Horus, Age of Satan, Æon of Set). Not necessarily time-sequential but can coexist and influence the perception of reality.

An initiatory degree characterized by the introduction of a new factor or 'Word' into the existing philosophical universe, sufficiently potent to evoke core change. The Magus identifies intensely with this Uttered Word, which becomes a personal universe.

The highest initiatory degree, representing the resolution of tension between Master and Magus, wherein the individual comprehends the greater synthesis of an Uttered Word with the æonic totality, ensuring harmony between existing and potential æons.

The state of 'higher man' or the realm of higher beings; a conceptual 'focus' for Xeper, giving direction to willed changes. It is that which is recognized, realized, and understood by the Elect perceiving higher being, representing the self ahead of itself.

Ancient Egyptian goddess personifying Justice and Truth; a principle of universal order and balance. For Setians, it represents living and acting in 'Truth', recognizing the inherent balance and justice within one's evolving self.

A reconstituted Order within the Temple of Set with Germanic esoteric roots, characterized as a knighthood dedicated to the quest for the Grail (the true self), emphasizing personal honor, loyalty, and the exploration of Germanic magical traditions.
Local-community or interest-based sub-organizations of the Temple of Set, acting as 'gateways' for Initiates to connect with the Temple and pursue shared initiatory interests, guided by a Sentinel.

Specialized project groups within the Temple of Set, focused on specific skills or areas of interest, which may include non-Setian members. They are less formal than Orders and Pylons and aim to explore particular subjects.

practical_system.description: The Temple of Set presents a practical system for individual self-transformation (Xeper) and the achievement of personal divinity, rooted in Black Magic (both Lesser and Greater forms). It operates as an initiatory school with a structured degree system (Setian I° to Ipsissimus VI°), emphasizing the development of individual will, intellect, and consciousness. The system involves philosophical study, ritual practice, and the exploration of various 'Words' or principles (e.g., Xem, Runa, Remanifest) that guide the Initiate's evolution. It is supported by an organizational framework including the Council of Nine, High Priest, Executive Director, and specialized Orders, Pylons, and Elements.
tools: Pentagram of Set: The official insignia, an inverse pentagram within a circular field, symbolizing the Divine Proportion, creation, change, and the distinctness of Set from the objective universe.

Jeweled Tablets of Set: A series of electronic/physical publications (Crystal, Ruby, Onyx, Sapphire, Amethyst, Topaz Tablets) serving as reference documents for different initiatory degrees, containing philosophical essays, magical practices, and administrative policies.
Scroll of Set: The monthly newsletter disseminating time-value information, articles, and reports to the Temple membership.
Ap-uat Library Project (ALP): A resource for identifying, acquiring, and making available specialized books and research materials to Setians.
Obsidian Mirror/Shewstone: A tool for revelation and accessing deeper knowledge, referenced in Aztec/Toltec legends and John Dee's practices.
Setian Initiatory Degrees (I°-VI°): A structured path for recognizing individual states of being and stages of evolution, not mere achievements or promotions.

The Word of Set / Æonic Words: Specific philosophical principles or concepts (e.g., Xeper, Xem, Runa, Remanifest, Essent, Arkte, Agape, Anatta, Agathon, Thelema, Indulgence) that define and drive the evolution of consciousness for Magi.

Computer-Assisted Telepathic Amplification Technology (speculative): Explored as a potential tool for enhancing mental communication and influencing reality, though current science limitations are acknowledged.
Music/Art/Literature: Utilized as tools for magical work, self-expression, and exploring archetypal forces and psychological states.
rituals: Greater Black Magic (GBM): Causing change in the subjective universe, often leading to objective change, involving intensive rational and intuitive thought (e.g., The Sphinx and the Chimæra, North Solstice X Working, Xem Working).

Lesser Black Magic (LBM): Influencing the objective universe through obscure physical or behavioral laws, including psychological manipulation, stage magic, and 'reading' people. Employed as a tool for practical purposes.
Enochian Keys Workings: Reinterpreted as 'Word of Set' for direct magical operation and access to 'æthyrs', distinct from corrupted historical versions.

Order-specific Rituals: Tailored rituals within Orders (e.g., Heart Sumble for Order of the Great Bear, Dromenon for Order of the Sepulcher of the Obsidian Masque) designed for specialized initiatory experiences and self-exploration.

Setian Ritual Practice: General principles involve using candles, incantations, and demonic names as psychological props to stimulate emotional force and focus will, recognizing these as tools rather than objects of worship.

relevant_quotes.text: For the first Working I decided to pronounce the 19th Key, invoking ZIM (the 13th Æthyr). Cornu required twice before any response. Then the result: I recall coming, under hazy circumstances, to a large wooden-beamed hall in which were seated a number of men around a table. I knew them to be the “Secret Chiefs” of the “White” tradition of whom Aleister Crowley and others have spoken.

Frankly I didn’t know what to make of the Book of Coming Forth by Night. It was certainly not at all what I had expected [although I hadn’t known what to expect the evening before]. Obviously it contained elements of ancient Egypt, Aleister Crowley, and the Church of Satan. But it mingled these in what was to me an odd and unfamiliar way. In some ways it seemed ancient, in other ways futuristic. It seemed to be speaking to me personally, but also to as-yet-unidentified others. It contained cosmology, philosophy, magic, evolution, cryptography, promises, and threats. Summarily it pretty well upset my entire applecart.
I promised him my soul, and swore an oath that I would stand up for him in this world and stand by him in the next.

What can I say about the Book of Coming Forth by Night? It is awesome. A Revelation. The true Mandate of the Dark. Holy Hastur, did it clear up a lot for me! Believe it or not, I knew these things - but, as has happened in the past, could not give voice to them, even in my own mind.
Behold, it is I who call you, because you are the guardians of the Æon of Set, zealous in what you do.

Pathetic earthlings - hurling your bodies out into the void, without the slightest inkling of who or what is out here. If you had known anything about the true nature of the universe, anything at all, you would’ve hidden from it in terror.
I’m a man in search of his true self. How archetypically American can you get? Everybody’s looking for his true self.

These two states, sleep and waking sleep, are the only two states of consciousness in which man lives. Besides them there are two states of consciousness possible for man, but they become accessible to a man only after a hard and prolonged struggle. These two higher states of consciousness are called self-consciousness and objective consciousness.

Anatta is one of the more elusive and controversial concepts in Buddhism. Generally-accepted definitions of it tend to leave the reader even more confused! I would summarize it as the proposition that there is no isolate, unique, and immortal psyche such as the Egyptians, Plato, and the Temple of Set postulate. Rather, so the Buddha said, what people think of as their “soul” is an ever-changing “rain” of impressions upon their bodily senses from within and without the physical body, creating the illusion of a self. Thus there is no conscious immortality, although there is natural, all-inclusive perpetuity.

If a person has been vital throughout his life and has fought to the end for his earthly existence, it is this ego which will refuse to die, even after the expiration of the flesh which housed it ... It is this vitality that will allow the Satanist to peek through the curtain of darkness and death and remain earthbound.

Magus Aquino raised his hood and moved before the pentagram, then turned to the Priesthood. Before he spoke, it was clear to all that Set had manifested himself in his High Priest and Magus. In fact Magus Aquino’s face was no longer apparent - there was a darkness within the cowl [later Anubis said that he saw a brief something changing within, but wasn't sure what]. He turned and very slowly looked at every one of the Priesthood. Set: “Never before have I stood in the midst of such majesty. The majesty of these young gods and goddesses. You are the Children of Set ... [and he listed the names]. I have lived through the pain of the Æon of Horus, and the pain and pleasure of the Age of Satan, and this is my Æon ... has passed - a bridge ... For my Temple that was dust (?) is dormant (?) no longer. Before me I see the Black Jackal, he who has opened the way for me ... and from the desert ... he who lurked ... And I have raised him up so that all may see.”
The Equinox has succumbed to my Solstice, and I, Set, am revealed in my Majesty.

I am the ageless Intelligence of this Universe. I created HarWer that I might define my Self. All other gods of all other times and nations have been created by men. This you know from the first Part of my Word, and from my manifest semblance, which alone is not of Earth.
Behold, it is I who call you, because you are the guardians of the Aeon of Set, zealous in what you do.

The Aeon of HarWer endured until the Equinox of the common year 1966, when HarWer and Set were fused in one composite being. And so commenced the time of Set-HarWer - known as the Age of Satan - which was to bridge the expiring Aeon of HarWer and the forthcoming Aeon of Set.

The “bastard title” is “Satan”, which is in Hebrew a title (“Adversary”) although in Egyptian it is the name Set-hen (“Majesty of Set”). It is by Set’s name that he is known within his Temple and Priesthood, with “Satan” being used only to identify him by his historic image to the profane.
Speak rather to me as to a friend. Do not bend your knee nor drop your eye ...

A lot of tortured verbiage has been written about Xem over the years. To me it always was a very simple, clear, and brilliant concept: the creation of an artificial “focus” for Xeper by each individual, much after the fashion of Nietzsche’s “horizon-building”, in order to give personal Xeper some cohesion, some direction.

critical_analysis.relevance: This book serves as the definitive foundational text and historical account of the Temple of Set, providing an in-depth exploration of its unique Left-Hand Path philosophy, initiatory system, and practical magical methodologies. It is crucial for understanding the ideological split from the Church of Satan and the subsequent development of a distinct esoteric tradition focused on individual self-deification (Xeper) within a defined metaphysical framework. The text contextualizes the Temple's concepts within ancient Egyptian, Greek, and other esoteric traditions, positioning it as an advanced school for conscious evolution.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary target audience is Setian Initiates of all degrees, particularly those seeking to deepen their understanding of the Temple's core philosophy, initiatory processes, and practical magic. It is also highly relevant for academic researchers and practitioners in Western Esotericism and Occultism who desire a rigorous, technical, and insider's perspective on the Temple of Set and its specific magical system. The author explicitly notes that it is not intended for the 'profane' or those lacking 'initiatory consciousness' capable of comprehending complex metaphysical concepts.
